intro: Pavonia yatarendana, commonly known as the Yatarenda shrub, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of showy, pink to red bract-like flowers. It typically thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
